event.title: <show-title>Magic Mike's Last Dance</show-title> <event-type-title>Rowdy Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Party with Mike & the boys one last time
event.description: What is a “Rowdy” screening? That means you can hoot, holler, and loudly swoon at the beautiful people on screen. That being said, Magic Mike is all about everyone having a good time, so using your phone, having a conversation, or being disrespectful to guests or staff will get you bounced out of the theater faster than you can say Channing Tatum.

show.title: Killer Klowns from Outer Space
show.headline: Horrific Harlequins with an appetite for close encounters!

posterImages.altText: Killer Klowns From Outer Space movie poster

event.title: <show-title>Killer Klowns from Outer Space</show-title>
event.headline: Horrific Harlequins with an appetite for close encounters!
event.description: The most forehead-exploding big-budget sci-fi/horror/comedy of the ‘80s, written and directed by the special effects wizards behind CRITTERS and the Large Marge monsterface scene from PEE-WEE’S BIG ADVENTURE. A circus tent-shaped meteor crashlands in the forest, releasing an army of neon-colored, face-painted intergalactic creatures who mummify humans in cotton candy cocoons and slurp their sweetened blood through crazy straws. These diabolical bozos mow through the populace using only the most entertaining means: invisible cars, carnivorous shadow puppets, popcorn blasters, decapitating boxing matches, hand-to-spinal-cord ventriloquism, and much, much more. The only people with the guts to stand up to these extraterrestrial sillybones are two kind-hearted teens and the horny local ice cream vendors. Watch for thundering man’s-man actor John Vernon as the homophobic small-town cop who just isn’t gonna put up with any of this space clown shit. All this topped off with a theme song by pioneering goofpunk band The Dickies. Not to be viewed by anyone who fears clowns or enjoying life. (Zack Carlson)

show.title: Space Jam
show.headline: Definitively, the Michael Jordan of animated sports films

event.title: <show-title>Space Jam</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Come on and slam, and welcome to the movie party jam
event.description:
What do you get when you mix a six-time NBA champ, a beloved cast of wacky characters, and one of the catchiest theme songs of the ‘90s? You get what just might be the greatest game of basketball ever seen on the big screen.

Join us for the SPACE JAM Movie Party, an out-of-this-world interactive screening filled with basketball, Looney Tunes, Monstars, and the GOAT himself, Michael Jordan. We’ve got hoops! We’ve got weights! We’ve got balls! Ok, we don’t have hoops or weights but we will have mini basketballs so you can fly like Mike, sweatbands for when you’re taking on the Monstars, and water bottles perfect for storing some of Michael’s Secret Stuff. Keep in mind that you will have to play us in a game of basketball, and if you lose, you’ll have to work at Moron Mountain, forever.

eventType.title: Movie Party

eventType.description: Spanning all genres, Alamo Drafthouse Movie Parties are an immersive, interactive experience for cinema fans featuring fun props, themed drinks, and more.

show.title: The Phantom of the Opera (2004)
show.headline: The classic musical comes to life on the big screen

event.title: <show-title>The Phantom of the Opera (2004)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wear the mask and sing the songs at this interactive epic
event.description:
Take BATMAN & ROBIN director Joel Schumacher, add in CATS scribe Andrew Lloyd Webber, throw in a huge dose of opera (with just a dash of Minnie Driver), and you’ve got yourself some grand campy goodness.

Join us for THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA Movie Party, a musical extravaganza that’ll throw its magical lasso around you and never let go. We’ll have candles to illuminate the chandelier scene, roses to celebrate Christine, bracelets from the Opera Ghost (or the Angel of Music, not sure which), and, of course, your very own Phantom mask. All we ask of you is that you and your friends come ready to belt out some opera (we're sure you'll sound molto bene) as we revel in the music of the night.

show.title: Bridesmaids
show.headline: Save the Date

event.title: <show-title>Bridesmaids</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: We're excited, relaxed, and ready to paaaaaaaaartyyyyy
event.description:
Gather up your gals (or guys) for a party celebrating Paul Feig’s 2011 frenemy masterpiece, BRIDESMAIDS.

This interactive bachelorette party features lemons so you can make some damn good, super fresh pink lemonade to impress your guests at your next Paris-themed party, poo spray just in case you eat some dodgy Brazilian food before the screening, and bridal veils because this is YOUR special day. Don’t let your screw-up friend take that away from you. So join us for a night of fun celebrating women's relationships of all kinds. Just be sure to get your tail lights fixed before driving over, otherwise you might get swept off your feet by the most charming, patient cop in all of Milwaukee (though that actually doesn’t sound too bad).

show.title: Possession (1981)
show.headline: A mind-bending psychosexual fever dream

event.title: <show-title>Possession (1981)</show-title>
event.headline: A mind-bending psychosexual fever dream
event.description: Something is wrong with Anna (Isabelle Adjani). Having taken a lover, she abruptly asks her husband, Mark (Sam Neill), for divorce. He's desperate for an explanation, but Anna's answers are elusive at best. She's in crisis – becoming emotional, avoidant, self-harming, and neglectful of their son. Mark has no idea, but behind her increasingly erratic behavior is a monstrous secret. The films of Andrej Zulawski lie beyond narrative, emotion, and sanity. POSSESSION is a raw depiction of the monstrosity of marital strife and the fear of female sexuality. An arthouse favorite combining existential dread with doppelgangers, blood, and body horror, POSSESSION is truly one of a kind.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.headline: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!
formats.description: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

formats.headline: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.
